intro: Euphrasia gustavei, commonly known as the Gustave's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Euphrasia gustavei is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions.
